article_text:
Can information companies participate in China’s huge market without selling their souls to the Communist Party? Facebook is the latest American tech firm to face this question, and critics are blaming the social-media giant for taking down a post about self-immolation by a Tibetan monk. The issue deserves more than easy condemnation.

China has long blocked Facebook, and founder Mark Zuckerberg has made overtures to Beijing to enter the country. In October he gave a speech in Mandarin at Tsinghua University, and earlier...

twitter.description: Mark Zuckerberg faces a dilemma if he wants to do business with China and its Communist censors, says an editorial in The Wall Street Journal.
twitter.title: Facebook and Beijing

article_summary:
China has long blocked Facebook, and founder Mark Zuckerberg has made overtures to Beijing to enter the country.
Facebook is the latest American tech firm to face this question, and critics are blaming the social-media giant for taking down a post about self-immolation by a Tibetan monk.
In October he gave a speech in Mandarin at Tsinghua University, and earlier...
Can information companies participate in China’s huge market without selling their souls to the Communist Party?
The issue deserves more than easy condemnation.
